programme.title: My Amityville Horror
programme.desc: For the first time in 35 years, Daniel Lutz recounts his version of the infamous Amityville haunting that terrified his family in 1975. Directed by Eric Walter.

programme.title: Lost in La Mancha
programme.desc: Follow director Terry Gilliam on his quest to bring the story of Don Quixote to the "big screen". At times hilarious, it's a unique, in-depth look at the harsher realities of filmmaking. Directed by Keith Fulton and Louis Pepe.

programme.title: The Search for General Tso
programme.desc: This mouthwateringly entertaining documentary traces the surprising origins of the iconic Chinese-American dish, from Shanghai to Middle America and beyond.

programme.title: Framing John Delorean
programme.desc: Money, power, politics, drugs, scandal, and fast cars. Discover the untold story of the controversial automaker's meteoric rise and shocking fall. Featuring Alec Baldwin. Directed by Don Argott and Sheena M. Joyce.

programme.title: Tabloid
programme.desc: Oscar-winner Errol Morris tells a twisted true tale of love, abduction, cloned dogs and Mormons in bondage, ripped from the headlines of 1970s tabloids.

programme.title: Tickled
programme.desc: After stumbling upon a bizarre “competitive endurance tickling” video online, wherein young men are paid to be tied up and tickled, reporter David Farrier reaches out to request a story from the company. But the reply he receives is shocking—the sender mocks Farrier's sexual orientation and threatens extreme legal action should he dig any deeper. So, like any good journalist confronted by a bully, he does just the opposite: he travels to the hidden tickling facilities in Los Angeles and uncovers a vast empire, known for harassing and harming the lives of those who protest their involvement in these films. The more he investigates, the stranger it gets, discovering secret identities and criminal activity. With humor and determination, Farrier and co-director Dylan Reeve summon up every resource available to get to the bottom of this tickling wormhole. Directed by David Farrier

programme.title: The Reagans
programme.desc: The Reagans forged a legacy as the first couple of the United States. This intimate portrait captures the Reagans' inspiring journey, historic partnership and touching love story. Directed by Robert Kline.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: 1900-1920 - World War I, The Russian Revolution & Woodrow Wilson
programme.desc: A look back at the early 1900s, climaxing with WWI & the Russian Revolution as the mother of the ensuing conflict between the British, Soviet, and newborn American Empire. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: 1920-1940 - Roosevelt, Hitler, Stalin: The Battle Of Ideas
programme.desc: The rise of Nazism and Adolph Hitler as the leader of Germany, the rise of Joseph Stalin as the Soviet leader and the election of Franklin D. Roosevelt as President of the United States. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: World War II
programme.desc: This first chapter explores the birth of the American Empire by focusing on Franklin D. Roosevelt, Winston Churchill and Joseph Stalin. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: Roosevelt, Truman & Wallace
programme.desc: Highlights from the historical upset of Harry Truman replacing Henry Wallace as Roosevelt's VP during his fourth term and how it propelled the US towards empire building. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: The Bomb - Censored
programme.desc: The strategies behind the US atomic bombings of Japan are explored as well as the new mythology that emerged from the war. The bombing haunted the Soviets and mistrust towards the Allies grew quickly. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: The Cold War
programme.desc: This chapter highlights Winston Churchill's Iron Curtain speech, the civil war in Greece and the Red Scare that prompts the rise of Joseph McCarthy, the House Un-American Activities Committee and the FBI. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: The '50s: Eisenhower, the Bomb & the Third World
programme.desc: Eisenhower & John Foster Dulles replace Truman. Stalin dies but relations with the Soviet Union turn colder. The doctrine of nuclear annihilation are explored, as are the Korean War & U.S. rearmament. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: JFK: To the Brink - Censored
programme.desc: Home to the world’s best documentaries -- from Academy Award winning classics and box office hits to festival darlings and cult favorites. Nonfiction storytelling at its best, curated by the best.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: Johnson, Nixon & Vietnam: Reversal of Fortune - Censored
programme.desc: Cataclysm in Vietnam as the war reaches a turning point - there's no going back. The betrayal by Richard Nixon. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: Reagan, Gorbachev & the Third World - Rise of the Right - Censored
programme.desc: Carter's dreams of change give way to Ronald Reagan's secret wars in Afghanistan and Central America. Gorbachev emerges. Fresh opportunities for peace arise. The debate over Reagan's legacy. Directed by Oliver Stone.

programme.title: The Untold History Of The United States: Bush & Clinton: Squandered Peace - New World Order
programme.desc: Russia introduced to American Capitalism. U.S. goes to war in Middle East. New World Order shaped. Directed by Oliver Stone.
